meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of an infant.
meanings.sent1: The baby's cries had an infantine quality to them.
meanings.sent2: The nursery was decorated in an infantine style with pastel colors and soft toys.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's playful and infantine behavior brought joy to the family.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as pure and innocent as an infantine smile.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the essence of innocence in the infantine faces of the cherubs.

meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a child in behavior or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The young girl's giggles were so infantine, they brightened everyone's day.
meanings.sent2: His playful and infantine antics made him a favorite among the neighborhood kids.
meanings.sent3: The kitten's curious and infantine nature led it to explore every corner of the house.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had an infantine sweetness that charmed all who heard it.
meanings.sent5: The innocence of her smile was truly infantine, capturing the hearts of all who saw it.
